Subjective: Left ear feels water-filled, painful. Pain worse after showering. Onset 2-3 days ago, gradually worsening. Left ear hearing impaired, annoying. Pain: 0-4 daily, 6-7 after showering. Unable to swim due to pain (new sport, few weeks). Cleans ears w/ cotton buds 3x/week. No general illness, no fever (felt), no body aches. Pain manageable, no painkillers taken. Social: Holiday in Turkey, new Dutch citizen. ICE: Wants doctor to look, wants pain to stop. Worried/scared about ear, not as good as right ear.
Objective: Temp: 36.2 C. Right ear: Clean, eardrum fine. Left ear: Pain on pulling tragus. Canal red, inflamed, swollen, thick. Eardrum not well visualized.
Assessment: Left otitis externa, likely due to water exposure (swimming) and cotton bud use.
Plan: Explanation: Left ear canal inflammation from water/cotton buds.
Meds: Paracetamol up to 4000mg/day PRN for pain.
Meds: Ear drops (anti-inflammatory, acidic) 3x/day for 1 week.
Advice: Keep left ear dry for 1 week.
Follow-up: Return in 1 week for re-evaluation.
